name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

key_work.title: Royal tour of Queen Elizabeth II
key_work.brief_description: In 1954, huge crowds greeted Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip on her Australian tour, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.

constellations_primary.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_primary.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

constellations_other.name: Spectacle
constellations_other.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.

start.title: The Queen
start.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Consolata Boyle, Andy Harries, Christine Langan, Tracey Seaward, BIM Distribuzione, Canal+, France 3 Cinéma, Future Films, Granada Productions, Pathé Pictures International, Pathé Renn Productions, Scott Rudin Productions, Alan MacDonald and Peter Morgan
start.headline_credit: France, Italy, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2006
start.brief_description: The Queen is an intimate behind the scenes glimpse at the interaction between HM Elizabeth II and Prime Minister Tony Blair during their struggle, following the death of Diana, to reach a compromise between what was a private tragedy for the Royal family and the public’s demand for an overt display of mourning.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

end.title: The Queen's Corgi
end.creator_credit: Ben Stassen, Vincent Kesteloot, Caroline Van Iseghem, Belga Productions, nWave Pictures, Johnny Smith and Rob Sprackling
end.brief_description: When the Queen’s favourite dog, Rex, becomes lost, he must make new friends and embrace new adventures in order to find his way back to the palace.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

links.description: The Queen is well known for her affection for her pet corgis – this animated comedy film starring Julie Walters as Queen Elizabeth II follows the adventures of a royal corgi named Rex who gets lost and tries to find his way home.

start.title: The Queen
start.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Consolata Boyle, Andy Harries, Christine Langan, Tracey Seaward, BIM Distribuzione, Canal+, France 3 Cinéma, Future Films, Granada Productions, Pathé Pictures International, Pathé Renn Productions, Scott Rudin Productions, Alan MacDonald and Peter Morgan

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty

end.title: The Wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

links.description: Royal weddings have long held a public fascination, from Prince Charles and Lady Diana’s in 1981 to Prince Harry’s wedding to actor Meghan Markle in 2018. The ceremony was televised and livestreamed from the Royal Family’s YouTube account.

start.title: The Crown
start.creator_credit: Amy Roberts, Andy Stebbing, Martin Harrison, Michael Casey and Oona O'Beirn
start.brief_description: The gripping, decades-spanning inside story of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and the Prime Ministers who shaped Britain’s post-war destiny.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

constellations_other.name: Royals
constellations_other.description: Royal watchers don't need to visit palaces around the world. There are enough stories about royalty on the silver and small screen to get their fix.

constellations_other.name: Power and privilege, monarchy and make-up
constellations_other.description: The upper echelons of society explored through colour, make-up and scandal.

end.title: The Queen
end.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Consolata Boyle, Andy Harries, Christine Langan, Tracey Seaward, BIM Distribuzione, Canal+, France 3 Cinéma, Future Films, Granada Productions, Pathé Pictures International, Pathé Renn Productions, Scott Rudin Productions, Alan MacDonald and Peter Morgan
end.headline_credit: France, Italy, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2006
end.brief_description: The Queen is an intimate behind the scenes glimpse at the interaction between HM Elizabeth II and Prime Minister Tony Blair during their struggle, following the death of Diana, to reach a compromise between what was a private tragedy for the Royal family and the public’s demand for an overt display of mourning.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

links.description: Also written by Peter Morgan, The Queen explores the aftermath of Princess Diana’s death (in a car accident while being chased by photographers), through intense media scrutiny, public reaction and the televised funeral.

start.title: The Wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle

end.title: The Windsors

video_links.name: TRAILER: The Windsors | Friday 27th May 10pm | Channel 4

end.brief_description: Comedy soap opera re-imagining the lives of the British Royal Family as you have never seen them before.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

links.description: British sitcom The Windsors is a parody performed through the lens of a soap opera, trivialising the lives and loves of the royal family with occasional real life inspiration for its raucous storylines.

start.title: The Queen in Australia
start.brief_description: In 1954, recently crowned Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh embarked on a two month tour of Australia.

links.description: Historical drama series The Crown includes dramatised scenes of the royal tour, including a reportedly real-life argument between the royal couple caught on camera by a newsreel crew – though the film was quickly handed over and destroyed.

start.brief_description: In 1954, huge crowds greeted Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip on her Australian tour, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.

links.description: When Queen Elizabeth II visited Australia in 1954, she was the first reigning monarch to do so. The tour was followed closely by newsreel crews and crowds and was the subject of the first colour documentary film made in Australia.

end.title: A Royal Night Out
end.creator_credit: Julian Jarrold, Claire Anderson, Douglas Rae, Robert Bernstein, Ecosse Films, Filmgate Films, North Light Film Studios, SCOPE Pictures, Screen Yorkshire, Laurence Dorman, Kevin Hood and Trevor De Silva

video_links.name: "A Royal Night Out" Theatrical Trailer - Now on iTunes & DVD (U.S.)
A Royal Night Out - Official UK Trailer - In Cinemas Now!

end.brief_description: The re-imagining of VE Day in 1945, when Princess Elizabeth and her sister, Margaret were allowed out from Buckingham Palace for the night to join in the celebrations, and encounter romance and danger.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

links.description: Set at the end of WWII, romantic comedy A Royal Night Out is an imagined account of the teenage Princess Elizabeth and Princess Margaret escaping the palace for a night out in London during the peace celebrations.
